properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 5 at 5:17PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a flood warning
for the following rivers in Washington...

Cedar River Near Landsburg affecting King County
Cedar River At Renton affecting King County
Green River Near Auburn affecting King County


Coming off the heels of the storm last weekend, and now the 2 to 5
inches of rain we have had in the central Cascades combined with
another 2 to 5 inches in the forecast, will drive the reservoirs
and streamflows up with the Cedar and Green Rivers going above flood
stage.

The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Cedar River At Renton
* from late tonight until further notice.
* At  4:15 PM Wednesday the stage was 12.4 feet.
* Flood stage is 13.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage around 2 AM
Thursday and crest near 14.4 feet around 4 AM Friday.
* Impact...At 13.0 feet, the Cedar River will cause minor flooding
along the river in Renton.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
